D3697C1D67A240F7A37AE49CAD050DFE.description: Co-construct a tool (e.g., rubric, checklist, self-evaluation form or peer-evaluation form) and use it to assess the process and products involved in their student-directed study.

53EC8B68CB6A4D96B846CD60A7345C22.description: Share the results of student-directed inquiry through research paper, display, presentation, performance, demonstration, representation, or video.

3F7B863F498C4A6C8E0C620D46AEC101.description: Explore one or more topics such as: compare the impact of various influences and experiences on human behavior and/or development (e.g., environments, relationships, traumas); research and assess current approaches to treatments of psychological disorders from various cultural perspectives; investigate and evaluate supports available for gender and sexually diverse students; evaluate various theories (e.g., classical, biological, psychobiological, interactionist, sociological) and clarify personal viewpoints regarding causes for criminal activity; explore aspects of ethical research in psychology such as, data collection, data management, permissions and citations; and, assemble and reflect on a portfolio that demonstrates an understanding of a career choice by reflecting upon personal suitability for a specific psychology related occupation (e.g., roles, responsibilities and skills, education level required including licensing requirement in Saskatchewan, salary and benefits, work environment, workplace hazards and safety considerations and future trends impacting the occupation).

B81CD4776BB54A9B9B93E07EC02F0627.description: Design and carry out a detailed exploration of one or more topics of personal interest relevant to Psychology 20.

7AE936501EAC4158BCA246508EB2E7B1.description: Explore how psychological trauma effects mental well-being and influences human behaviour.

9B58C6ED110C4F20B92BC1D35C090A41.description: Analyze the differences between equity and equality of condition and how society is shaped by these concepts.

58E9E8A605BD43FDB8ED91551362F34F.description: Explore and analyze moral considerations (e.g., plastic surgery, perceptions of body image, body dysmorphia) for societies’ version of physical beauty.

2C2C5A56391D4835A5CA3B5BB4FA9B8A.description: Investigate contemporary beliefs for characteristics of beauty and the influences of cultures and media on defining qualities of beauty.

B34424A39AF44F3188408A00C9977F59.description: Analyze what constitutes a healthy relationship.

740615B3ED684622A5038734729B23EE.description: Explore the differences between liking and loving someone.

931AF36229E24301AF60A459D8A0E860.description: Explore socio-cultural views related to intimacy, respect and communication in healthy romantic relationships.

A248E0DBC64D42598E727AA73C273A91.description: Investigate the stages of the cycle of abuse and supports available to survivors

5B597EE58BAC4F1CA0A4C96E5F0040A5.description: Explain factors that influence attraction and relationships.

F647ECC5523D48429719A6D04D8F7220.description: Analyze collective behaviours and the influences of “groupthink” on group behaviours (e.g., gangs, cults, crowds, mobs, social movements, political parties).

ECABE08552C74B7EB1DD4A4102137943.description: Investigate an area of work within the community that provides support for mental health (e.g., nurses, social workers, doctors, religious leaders, Elders, professors, counsellors).

DCE4F643E84D4E178EF23F67E82AB8BA.description: Investigate forms of dysfunctional behaviours (e.g., defiance, intimidation, manipulation) and the socio emotional impact on others.

FC1ADCFCE5A54A0DA433FFD618C8CD98.description: Discuss effects of stereotyping, prejudice and discrimination on individual and group behaviour.

EB72BCCD659946859C73A03F9F71FAD9.description: Investigate possible consequences (e.g., physical inactivity, misuse of content, social skills) of extended daily use of screen time on one’s life.

9F5EBCA85E30493DB70A8473635C9D79.description: Examine challenges that various worldviews can present in social situations in a culturally diverse society.

509C495819AB45F79DB4AB3714C0A84F.description: Evaluate dysfunctional behaviors (e.g., mood disorders, eating disorders, addictions, self-harm) and their impacts on behaviour and social development.

0065AD425399454085DC9D52B5F8CB16.description: Examine influences family and culture have on one’s social relationships and interactions.

331713598A6B4846926B73CDCCA4EC8A.description: Conduct an inquiry into how perception affects behaviour.

C3EDC27D3C15469F84F8E1CAEEAEACE9.description: Analyze how transitions (e.g., from one country to another, one culture to another, one community to another) impact the individual and society.

69EBFCFCD7784F89B67CD7C5C0209EC5.description: Investigate various social movements present in own community.

84AD9514F9FB44D6BE33D1001F82F103.description: Examine differences between compliance, conformity and obedience and the social perception of dissident knowledge.

D0AFA475D7854F659B98255820462969.description: Critique influences of culture and social norms on the definition of concepts of justice in a society.

AE00CBFC54784E98A4C350362DDEE96A.description: Investigate various types of power and their influence on social norms, values, privileges and beliefs.

7A5202AF61AA40CBBBAAB8A271AD3F40.description: Analyze the impact of social-constructivism ideas on developmental behaviours

C373BF2FE9004A64A09F32F5C770F0D9.description: Differentiate between society’s views on physical health and mental health.

7669266DB81940DCBAA579253E350A93.description: Investigate consequences of substance misuse on adolescent brain development.

5BC3C0A7EA9D4CAFAA4574A2381EF9DE.description: Examine the impact of addiction on one’s relationships (e.g., friends, family).

D723395824B84305B457189D36B96BA9.description: Examine studies that present a correlation between drug, alcohol, chemical use and effects on one’s mental health.

8A73E7F17E9C4DF0BBF323BAAABA2201.description: Investigate common misconceptions that can have an impact on accessing mental health treatments and resources and develop a project (e.g., Public Service Announcements, video, advertisements, pamphlet, picture book) to dispel negative perceptions.

F5642C383A3848E0A6B4264DDD2A4C40.description: Create a plan that presents resources available in own community to develop resiliency and coping strategies.

A3DA38443A8D405F9303CAA7769BB5D7.description: Explore how various cultures define and cope with anxiety and identify strategies used to deal with related emotions.

4230B6E6D64F4776B3D66C48F8DE8F34.description: Evaluate how stress and anxiety (e.g., finances, family, social, work, nutrition, physical health) can have an impact on emotional health and well-being and research best practice treatments and supports.

876AEDA3FC62474E804D7DA272FCF19E.description: Discuss relationships between health, substance abuse and addictions and the influence of one’s personal environment.

75997A5003314F34A2B71F67196D2706.description: Investigate influences of spirituality in holistic development and behaviour of self and others.

7AEFB383087646DE97E5FABE9D4CC09D.description: Critique in what ways culture, gender, worldview and self-esteem influence perception.

D57E268D9F274213824714EC8DCDBE35.description: Examine how an individual makes sense of the world and how worldview influences behaviour.

6073C894A1C94CC5B9188A898AC5F694.description: Investigate connections between mental health and personal environment in relation to holistic development and behaviour.

B2C422143FFD47A3B8841396E01C50B6.description: Create a representation (brochure, media advertisement, display, oral presentation) that fosters awareness for inclusion, community support organizations or positive lifestyles.

4537C665F24140FFA059721175055098.description: Investigate conflict resolution, solution seeking and community support available to an individual in time of crisis (e.g., healing circle, healing lodge, mental health, addiction group, mentor, counse llor).

D230A858E4184386B7D20AB5627E7E96.description: Examine the levels of Maslow’s Hierarchy of Needs and reflect on what motivates people’s behaviour in various (e.g., family, peers, teachers, work colleagues) relationships.

A73327A73F7E4A7FB0E8F11003F691D6.description: Explore current statistics related to Saskatchewan domestic violence (missing and murdered Indigenous women, spousal, child and elder abuse) and impacts on individuals and society

9BC064F04ED04B09B030A2B977F83290.description: Investigate effects of violence, aggression and types of abuse (e.g., cycle of violence, bullying, consent) on an individual and implications for communities.

25D64239CD7D4FAE983F5CB921F973F4.description: Examine how the use of technology (e.g., social media, gaming, texting) can affect interpersonal relationships.

4852D5B2D7764C66BF7010FED75B21EE.description: Explore the relationship between effective and perceived communication (e.g., verbal, non-verbal, social media) and how each affects an individual.

64DCAFEFC6664E6E9A3809C236402CF7.description: Investigate how peer pressure (e.g., bullying, gangs, team work, supportive friendships) can have an effect on perception of self and others.

7966294BCF024077921A8F5CB0D18144.description: Evaluate the impact of isolation and exclusion on self-esteem and self-image.

8E3E248D972A42B9A9B7491F9DD987D8.description: Analyze benefits and challenges of acceptance, inclusion and sense of belonging in a relationship.

56C61CC4837342338BEDDEA9B403DD89.description: Examine various kinds of relationships (e.g., friend, peer, relative, colleague, authority figure, mentor) present in a community and analyze how their actions have an impact on an individual.

DC19455457164D45A609CDBCB12F2D06.description: Discuss previous knowledge about relationships and what constitutes a healthy relationship.

CD1A82A2A1904E6481FCD411E048AB77.description: Assess impacts of individual behaviour on relationships and society.

DCBB4144020140018541DAF5C4E09CA2.description: Create a representation (e.g., mind map or cluster diagram, story board) that exemplifies the relationship among one’s personality, spiritual beliefs and mental processes and impact on daily life.

93D4419334BC4051BB33FA1183E6778D.description: Examine learning style theories and possible influences on learning.

2F5FC5450C04467F8A8D1955396A8AE6.description: Investigate historical and contemporary beliefs regarding intelligence (e.g., theories, tests, EQ intelligence, First Nations and Métis traditional worldviews, multiple intelligences, Black and Asian cultural representations).

45073A69F6624FE8B30E5B7926FC1381.description: Determine processes used to make sense of the behaviours of others and factors (e.g., self-schema, culture) that affect judgement.

9DCF1CD0972540F39A2ADC807F8EDB40.description: Explore the perception that gender may have an influence on learning.

353C97EDFE2E4302AECE0AE1E042F0C7.description: Analyze what it means to learn, how social contexts affect how people learn and how one’s gender may affect learning.

28AD7C1771194F93AEC740363DD11E62.description: Investigate interconnectedness of intellectual, physical, emotional and spiritual aspects of the whole person expressed in First Nations and Métis traditional worldviews.

E9996DD872F248A49DA830B61B472B62.description: Investigate what it means to think and how sociocultural influences affect our thoughts and behaviours.

34706899E2634CBC8F2EE62D3E33652B.description: Investigate various mental processes in social contexts.

C6F8BB122EF847A29B8858E9045E3BCB.description: Conduct an inquiry into how injuries of the nervous and/or endocrine system (e.g., psychological trauma, concussion, acquired brain injury, Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder) might influence thoughts, feelings, perceptions and behaviours.

20B81E58A31744FDABDACAA14B1FF664.description: Investigate how various techniques used by television, movie producers and game developers influence attitudes of an individual.

3B4B46A828D44F12A558829505C2AA9E.description: Explore influences of social schemas (e.g., world views, experiences) and how they shape an individual’s attitudes and perceptions using various cultural perspectives (e.g., First Nations, Métis and Inuit, Black, Asian).

87CD841D63F84CABBB9159E97BC27CC6.description: Create a representation (e.g., graphic drawing, visual advertisement, photo collage) that compares attributes of the social-cognitive, dispositional, biological and traditional First Nations and Métis approaches to personality development.

61B9D18FDD7C426AA05F598C6B610316.description: Assess ways in which biological influences affect behaviours.

458C421312294EEA9B979CDF7267596E.description: Investigate the development of various temperaments (e.g., thoughts, feelings) as they apply to own life.

0E447AB5867D4D6DADFC37C1F7E1CA01.description: Assess strengths and limitations of dispositional approaches to personality.

82605ADFB5974631AB0C9245F97FCEC1.description: Analyze contributions of social-cognitive theories to understanding of personality.

AD55432F3B644A6F85F46D9FFCACC61B.description: Investigate concepts of social-cognitive, dispositional and biological approaches to personality and their affect on an individual.

D0A5FE4A88BC491786394909BE699915.description: Examine the influence of a community's worldviews on the development of a child's self-concept and life plan

2B52F29C743244F788AABEDBC78C592A.description: Examine one’s ability to interpret the perception of others' emotions in order to understand and adjust one's behaviour accordingly.

6193B27F942F42BEA30A70427C69C17D.description: Investigate the theory of emotional intelligence and its role in socioemotional development of youth.

D9B7108F5A724B89AC6ABA32960324D4.description: Analyze influences of friendships, peer pressure and bullying on socioemotional development and own lives.

DD3D77B5B58A4DE6BC9113276CDC171E.description: Examine sociocultural influences of economic and social status on childhood and adolescent development.

CD741B24F44B4746949DD61C6590C368.description: Analyze how children learn values, develop moral and ethical behaviour and potentialimpact on decision making in adolescence.

7270E4F0D3A548F4A3E6BB0A7AB1A58B.description: Investigate attachment development in children, types of attachments and short and long-term effects of social deprivation (e.g., neglect, abuse, removal from home).

5AFB998367364667AD2304AFA2A0DED9.description: Creatively represent different parenting styles (e.g., role play scenario, cartoon or comic strip, mock interview).

775A7E8AA5784D4EA017B838B2333291.description: Differentiate among parenting styles and their possible influences on youth.

9EE3B37E7FE3488999A06278F4873643.description: Examine the role that birth order may play in the socioemotional development of a child.

873ACEE32AEE48A69E124AFFC9692CF3.description: Discuss socioemotional development that takes place during mid-childhood throughadolescence.

65CA196E355D40C2A6AE9FACA8FF457C.description: Analyze differences between emotions and feelings regarding social and cultural influences on emotional expression.

BA065BA672F740E690C80C874D1976D7.description: Investigate socioemotional development from early childhood through

0348A77E85DF4287881366F7B6C9FA71.description: Examine how social perceptions (e.g., stereotypes, prejudice, discrimination) are formed and changed.

EE84BDB18E66425787CFF8A0A7B3335C.description: Determine how one’s thoughts, feelings and behaviours can influence others.

0C0EA72BD2354C13890CEB9D54B933F9.description: Discuss the impact of symbols/logos that affect emotions and attitudes (e.g., sport logos, mascots, media).

34CB83BC3F17400C930962CE114C6ADE.description: Create a representation that demonstrates the presence of motivation, attitude and emotion in own life (e.g., casting agency, academic program, television commercial promoting yourself).

3BD27BFFEE76496AA5F1395941954F32.description: Analyze differences among motivation, attitude and emotions and determine the roles each plays in performance (e.g., sports, academics, arts).

C638D949BC2A4A4CA3EDC46DF806A304.description: Examine how the perception of one’s physical and cultural environment can influence the behaviours, relationships and life goals of a person.

69E923A42E8B44A692A3378CE24B495E.description: Explore the challenges (e.g., language, lifestyle, customs, laws) a newcomer might face when integrating into a new culture.

EDD807070A014AD5AC4392E3C39430ED.description: Investigate and evaluate ethical and moral issues (e.g., genetic engineering, organ donation, organ transplants).

4467CBEA49DD41F79B363E2EDEFDC434.description: Investigate the role and function of the endocrine system and the effects stimulants, depressants and hallucinogens have on the body’s ability to process information.

6AE78AC585F640C39C439A5B75DB156B.description: Determine how the brain processes sensory information and distinguish the differences among sensation, perception and subliminal perception.

F2C335900B454EB2A0DF0C737571FB2C.description: Analyze the role of socio-cultural influences such as customs, lifestyles and values, on physical and social development.

9F9001899607468D8F19AF82B3C99FFC.description: Examine the influences of the four dimensions of being (biological, cognitive, emotional and spiritual), as they are presented in Indigenous Ways of Knowing as well as their link to behaviors and interpersonal relationships.

BDFEA040A41546D1AAF6A14B6EE5DDB7.description: Explore how biological, cognitive, emotional and spiritual dimensions and social factors influence the way we think and feel about the world.

DED8CFC39F95422799CEEC3CD7EC2F86.description: Research and compare validity, reliability and ethical issues in various research methods (e.g., interview, observation, case study) used in psychology.

F32042F765CD4B068FFE329F0E961579.description: Investigate historical shifts in cultural industries (e.g., fashion, music, media, technology) that influence thoughts, feelings and behaviour

614BED9C2475460997BBEA860928E512.description: Examine explanations for human behaviour from various cultural perspectives.

D4B71BF9EE4344A685A9F21C224DA22D.description: Analyze theoretical perspectives on human social actions and interactions.

D494C695E251463CAE030EBA62BD2A72.description: Investigate the role of social psychology as an evolving science.

CC5E600E1DF1412EAAFAD89A156C8EFA.description: Examine historical shifts in social psychology including major theoretical perspectives, research methods related to behaviourusing various cultural perspectives.
